Class Monster

java.lang.Object
characters.Character
characters.Monster
All Implemented Interfaces:
combat.Combatant, items.Lootable, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ThugGang, TwistedMutant
public abstract class Monster extends Character implements items.Lootable
Represents a monster that the hero will face in combat.

This abstract class extends Character and implements the Lootable interface, meaning that monsters have combat-related attributes and can drop loot upon defeat.

The monster’s attributes (health, will points, and strength) are scaled according to the game’s Difficulty level. Experience value and loot drops are determined by the monster’s danger rating and difficulty.

Each monster also maintains a reference to a loot table, which defines the potential items that can be dropped when defeated. The loot table is automatically selected based on the monster’s difficulty level.

See Also:

  • Lootable
  • LootFactory
  • Difficulty

    • Monster

      public Monster(String name, int healthPoints, int willPoints, int strength, int dangerRating, levels.Difficulty difficulty)
      Constructs a new monster with attributes scaled according to the given difficulty.
      Parameters:
      name - the monster's name
      healthPoints - the base health points before scaling
      willPoints - the base will points before scaling
      strength - the base strength before scaling
      dangerRating - a number indicating how dangerous this monster is
      difficulty - the game difficulty level

    • lootTable

      public List<Function<Monster, items.Item>> lootTable()
      Returns the list of loot-generating functions associated with this entity.

      Each function maps a Monster instance to an Item, allowing contextual loot generation.

      Returns the list of loot generation functions that define which items can drop from this monster, based on difficulty.

      Specified by:
      lootTable in interface items.Lootable
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of loot-generating functions, or an empty list if no loot is defined

    • chooseAction

      public combat.CombatAction chooseAction(combat.Combatant target)
      Determines the combat action this monster will take during its turn.

      By default:

      • If the monster’s health points are 2 or lower, it will use the SelfHeal action.
      • Otherwise, it will perform a standard Attack.
      Specified by:
      chooseAction in interface combat.Combatant
      Overrides:
      chooseAction in class Character
      Parameters:
      target - the intended target of the action (typically the hero)
      Returns:
      the chosen CombatAction for this turn

    • useSpecialSkill

      public void useSpecialSkill(combat.Combatant target)
      Uses the monster’s special skill on the specified target.

      This method should be overridden by subclasses that define unique special abilities or attacks.

      Specified by:
      useSpecialSkill in interface combat.Combatant
      Parameters:
      target - the target of the special skill
